comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Taken from almost the same place as -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3310894836/]Phillips Collection, PhM

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This photo is slightly earlier judging by the vegetation.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The trees and vegetation had grown up considerably by 1907 when Arthur Streeton painted "Sydney Harbour from Penshurst (Cremorne)" - commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Arthur_Streeton_-_Sydney_Harbour_from_Penshurst_(Cremorne)_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg - click through to large size. Original at AGNSW.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I always find it's best to go straight to the source: www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/collection/works/OA29.1962/ - click through to large size. :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Indeed!  But the GoogleArtProject version is sooo much higher-res!  You can almost see what Arthur had for lunch!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Ah, so it is! How strange that the AGNSW would provide a higher res version to the Google Art Project than they'd release on their own catalogue.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The Great God of Google is gradually taking control ...

I forgot to add the reason for posting the Streeton 1907 link - it means that this photo showing a lot of ships hanging around on moorings, has little to do with the Point Piper panorama - it is much earlier - in the 1890s.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Good point, I'm not feeling the GWF for our panorama. It is interesting to note, as you say. just how many large vessels there are at any one time. As in this pic, none of the vessels on the Point Piper pano image are dressed in 'party' bunting. Just another day on Sydney Harbour?!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment._content: See also ANMS1092[252]
